entry.title: Jacobus Capitein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jacobus Capitein (pictured), who was sold into slavery at either age 7 or 8, promoted proslavery arguments based on Christianity?

entry.title: Aox Inc. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Aox Inc., a maker of computer expansion cards, was named after the founders' dog?

entry.title: Rebecca Blake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rebecca Blake, Anglo-Romanian captain of the Romania women's national cricket team, also led the French team to victory in a six-team tournament?

entry.title: a public TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that episodes of such game shows as Double Dare, Finders Keepers, and You Bet Your Life were filmed at the Philadelphia studios of a public TV station?

entry.title: Bear Witness (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bear Witness reviewers said, "The songs were richer than the first wave of Madonna's hits"?

entry.title: Leonard Kriegel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Leonard Kriegel, who had polio, insisted on using the term "cripple" in his works to describe his illness?

entry.title: "one of the finest cut brick façades" in the United Kingdom (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "one of the finest cut brick façades" in the United Kingdom has been partially obscured by scaffolding for four years, as funds are raised for its repair?

entry.title: Claudia Fleming (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Claudia Fleming's dessert cookbook went out of print due to poor sales, used copies began circulating on eBay for hundreds of dollars?
